jobs.name: V2_1Active_table_check
jobs.description: Orchestration job with parameters to extract data from Src to stg and then stg to target

jobs.name: V2_2Extract_basedon_loadtype2
jobs.description: Extracting data from source when IS_ACTIVE is true

1.value:
/* Note: this query will be run as a subquery for the purposes of sampling the data.

   As such it will be restricted by any subquery limitations specified by the current platform. */
   
   SELECT 
UPPER(TABLE_NAME) TABLE_NAME,UPPER(LOAD_TYPE) LOAD_TYPE,IS_ACTIVE
FROM 
RESTAURANTSALES.RESTAURANT_METADATA.TABLE_LOAD_METADATA
WHERE IS_ACTIVE =1

###
# Variables are directly accessible: 
#   print (myvar)
# Updating a variable:
#   context.updateVariable('myvar', 'new-value')
# Grid Variables are accessible via the context:
#   print (context.getGridVariable('mygridvar'))
# Updating a grid variable:
#   context.updateGridVariable('mygridvar', [['list','of'],['lists','!']])
# A database cursor can be accessed from the context (Jython only):
#   cursor = context.cursor()
#   cursor.execute('select count(*) from mytable')
#   rowcount = cursor.fetchone()[0]
###
print (context.getGridVariable('GRID_VAR_TBL_LOADTYPE'))
print(JV_TABLE_NAME)
print (JV_LOADTYPE)

/* Note: this query will be run as a subquery for the purposes of sampling the data.
   As such it will be restricted by any subquery limitations specified by the current platform. */
   
   SELECT
  DATE_PART('EPOCH_SECOND',current_timestamp) as BATCHID
  FROM RESTAURANTSALES.RESTAURANT_METADATA.TABLE_LOAD_METADATA
	WHERE TABLE_NAME LIKE  '${ENV_VAR_TBL_TABLENAME}'

for i in context.getGridVariable('DES_COLUMNS'):
 if i[1]=='Yes':
  context.updateVariable('JV_PRIMARYKEY', i[0])

definition.name: DES_COLUMNS
definition.description: This will have metadata of the destination columns

891.text:
**Detecting changes** in the source and destination tables using 'Detect changes' component.
This is then filtered to pick the non identical components using 'filter ' component

definition.name: DES_COLUMNS
definition.description: This will have metadata of the destination columns

definition.name: DES_COLUMNS
definition.description: This will have metadata of the destination columns

1.value:
SELECT OD.order_ID, SUM(PRICE) ORDER_SPEND FROM RESTAURANTSALES.RESTAURANT_DB_DES.ORDER_DETAILS_DES OD
INNER JOIN RESTAURANTSALES.RESTAURANT_DB_DES.MENU_ITEMS_DES MI
ON OD.ITEM_ID=MI.MENU_ITEM_ID
GROUP BY order_ID
ORDER BY 2 DESC LIMIT 1
